WorkItem.Description:
v 2.2.0b5
Â 
Optimizer was recommending a set with only 521 defense, even with a crit chance <= 0 filter set.  All other options unchanged.  Noticed my pvp pants had been selected and the numbers seemed to add up.  XML attached.

Comments.Message: What's the bug here? Resilience does reduce your chance to be crit.

Resilience works in any PvE setting to reduce the chance to be crit.  The pluses of using Resilience is that a little resilience goes pretty far in reducing chance to be crit.  The downside is that you do not gain the other benefits that Defense offers - Dodge, Parry, Block, all that fun stuff.  For Warriors and Paladins, I would almost never recommend Resil to be used, there's just too much good that comes from Defense.

81.97 Resil = 1% crit reduction.  To double-check Rawr, you can use the calculator here: (http://www.tankingtips.com/tanking-formulas).
Indeed, it's not typically good to wear PvP gear for uncrittability, but it IS possible that things line up such that that's the best way (especially if optimizing for threat).
